long_desc.thetext:
Currently, the following tests fail in framework's test/ Testrunner:
ui/LocaleSwitch/TestLabel locale/Locale/testTranslation locale/Date/testDayNames util/NumberFormat/testNumber
Error message in the "Test Results" pane for all errors is: "Type Error: content is null".
These errors show up in the built and the source version of the test app, *but only* when you run all tests. I was not able to reproduce the errors by only running the test itself, or the enclosing class, or the enclosing group.
Can anyone comment on this?!

One assumption was that the tests fail due to recent changes in the translation service of the generator. But looking at ui/LocaleSwitch/TestLable it seems to me that the test relies entirely on dynamic translation data, and not on any data from .po or other file generated by the generator. - Is that true?!

The error underlying all the listed tests was in qx.ui.basic.Label; fixed with r17273.
The error was in the _onChangeLocale handler that didn't check for null return values of Label.getContent(). It had nothing to do with generator output. During fixing this bug, it appeared very difficult to debug test methods, such as the corresponding qx.test.ui.LocalSwitch.testLocale(), which triggered the exception. Various browsers (FF2, FF3, Opera) did not honor a "debugger;" statement early in the method.
mass correction: set previously unspecified target milestone to 0.8.2
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
